title: Angular momentum - puck collides with rod

content.question: A rod is attached to a pivot at one end and rests on a horizontal surface, as shown. Frictional forces are negligible. In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, a puck is launched perpendicularly to the rod and makes contact at the far edge of the rod while traveling with a speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. The angular momentum of the puck with respect to the pivot immediately before impact is <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. In Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the same puck is launched again at the rod but at an angle of <math alttext="30 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>30Â°</mtext></math> to the rod. The puck makes contact at the center of the rod while traveling with speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. The angular momentum of the puck with respect to the pivot immediately before impact is <math alttext="L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly represents <math alttext="L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> in terms of <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="L sub 2 equals L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="L sub 2 equals, the fraction the square root of 3, end root, over 4, end fraction, times L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="L sub 2 equals, one half L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="L sub 2 equals, one fourth L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="L sub 2 equals, one fourth L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
